I'm grateful some crypto exchanges are trying to resist the shut down of all Russian citizen accounts.

That's noble.

But that's not the point of crypto.

If we're building a banking system that can be shut down it will be shut down.

We need DeFi not crypto banks.

Bankless.
People under 40 holding gold ETFs instead of crypto...why?

Must have skills for surviving the 2020s.

- private key management
- DeFi
- cold storage
- encrypted messaging
- exit planning
- digital freelancing
- crypto investing
- VPN tunneling

No longer geek stuff.

These are everyday survival skills.

If the Biden administration, or the CCP, or the Putin regime, or Ursula Von Der Leyen can send it a letter asking it to shut down...

it's probably not decentralized.

Imagine sending a letter to TCP/IP or ethereum.

You know how crypto geeks have always debated each other on which protocols are decentralized enough to resist "nation state level" attack?

It's no longer hypothetical.

We're about to see real time.

The internet has no borders.

We see, hear, & feel what other humans experience all over the world. One digital neighborhood.
